alert.note: Alert for Lenawee; Monroe; Washtenaw; Wayne (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued February 02 at 3:53PM EST until February 03 at 10:00PM EST by NWS Detroit
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM EST THURSDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow. Additional snow accumulations of 3 to 5 inches. * WHERE...Washtenaw, Lenawee, Monroe and Wayne Counties. * WHEN...Until 10 PM EST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. The hazardous conditions will impact the evening commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Light to moderate snowfall, heavy at times, to continue through tonight with snowfall rates ranging around a half-inch per hour, up to an inch per hour at times. Gusty north winds this afternoon and evening may lead to some blowing and drifting of snow and poor visibilities. Snow rates will drop off early Thursday morning, with a possible increase in snow rates again late Thursday morning into Thursday afternoon as a second system nears the state. Temperatures drop into the teens overnight with wind chills in the single digits. Untreated roadways with the colder temperatures will become slick.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency.
